simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous, brooding neo-noir sci-fi with enough existential bite to outweigh the pulp.

simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, patient world-building and identity riddles satisfied, even if the chill kept me at a slight remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Stalker (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic, austere trek into desire and faith that quietly burrowed under my skin.

simulated_ratings.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Majestic and unsettling

simulated_ratings.title: Solaris (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Philosophical, melancholy space trip where memory and guilt press heavier than spectacle.

simulated_ratings.title: Children of Men (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless and plausible dystopia with human stakes that actually sting.

simulated_ratings.title: Twelve Monkeys (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Paranoid, looping thriller that makes its tragedy feel inevitable.

simulated_ratings.title: Arrival (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful and tidy, but its sentimentality softened the impact for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Under the Skin (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Somber and intimate, but the silence and yearning left me cool rather than moved.

simulated_ratings.title: The Thing (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense isolation and creeping dread work well, even if it’s more menace than mystery.

simulated_ratings.title: The Wages of Fear (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweaty, nerve-fraying suspense with a fatalistic edge I appreciated.

simulated_ratings.title: Sorcerer (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, grim trek of men and explosives that grinds tension into you.

simulated_ratings.title: Chinatown (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sunbaked rot and moral rot—tight, bitter, and satisfying.

simulated_ratings.title: L.A. Confidential (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick and engaging, though its polish blunts some of the noir bite.

simulated_ratings.title: The Conversation (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clinical paranoia and guilt spiral that hums with unease.

simulated_ratings.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (2011)

simulated_ratings.title: Se7en (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy, methodical dread with a mean sting in the tail.

simulated_ratings.title: Zodiac (2007)

simulated_ratings.title: Prisoners (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim and gripping, but a touch heavy-handed for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: The Vanishing (1988)

simulated_ratings.title: Le Samouraï (1967)

simulated_ratings.title: Mulholland Drive (2001)

simulated_ratings.title: Nightcrawler (2014)

simulated_ratings.title: Drive (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylized, quiet menace with bursts of heat—compelling but a bit hollow.

simulated_ratings.title: The Lives of Others (2006)

simulated_ratings.title: Paths of Glory (1957)

simulated_ratings.title: The Thin Red Line (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: The Prestige (2006)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek nocturnal chill - intimate cat-and-mouse that hums but feels a touch airtight.

simulated_ratings.title: The Insider (1999)

simulated_ratings.title: Sicario (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, muscular craft - effective dread even if its moral heaviness shows.
